label: TIE Get File First References Example
info:
This sample invokes the TIE DXL service to retrieve the set of systems which
have referenced a file (as identified by hashes). The response to the TIE
request is printed to the Node-RED `debug` tab.

### Prerequisites

* The samples configuration step has been completed (see the
  [DXL Configuration Sample](https://github.com/opendxl/node-red-contrib-dxl/wiki/Client-Configuration)).
* A TIE service is available on the DXL fabric.

### Setup

Edit the `Specify file hashes` node and modify the `Payload` property with the
hashes of the file that you want to use for the lookup.

The default hashes used in the JSON-formatted document for this node
pertain to `notepad.exe`:

```json
{
  "md5": "f2c7bb8acc97f92e987a2d4087d021b1",
  "sha1": "7eb0139d2175739b3ccb0d1110067820be6abd29",
  "sha256": "142e1d688ef0568370c37187fd9f2351d7ddeda574f8bfa9b0fa4ef42db85aa2"
}
```

This sample is equivalent to running the `"Where Has File Run"` action in the
`"TIE Reputations"` page within ePO.

A simple way to determine a valid set of hashes to use with this sample is
detailed below:

* Open ePO and navigate to the `"TIE Reputations"` page.
* Select the `"File Search"` tab
* Select a `file` in the list
* Click the `"Actions"` button at the bottom left and select
`"Where Has File Run"`
* The `"Where Has File Run"` results page is displayed. The GUIDs associated
with the systems in this list are what will be displayed when the sample is
executed.
* Close the `"Where Has File Run"` results
* Click on the same `file` to display its associated reputation information
* In the `"File Reputations Information"` page copy the `"MD5 Hash"`,
`"SHA-1 Hash"`, and `"SHA-256 Hash"` values and paste them into the sample
prior to running (as shown in the example above)

To deploy the flow, press the `Deploy` button in the upper-right corner of the
screen. If Node-RED is able to properly connect to the DXL fabric, a green dot
with the word `connected` should appear under the
`Get first references from TIE` node.

### Running

To exercise the flow, double-click the button on the left side of the
`Specify file hashes` node.

### Output

The output in the Node-RED `debug` tab should appear similar to the following:

```
▶ [ object, object, object ]
```

Click on the right arrow buttons to expand the contents of the object. The
content should look similar to the following:

```
▼ array[2]
 ▼ 0: object
     date: 1475873692
     agentGuid: "{3a6f574a-3e6f-436d-acd4-bcde336b054d}"
 ▼ 1: object
     date: 1476316674
     agentGuid: "{d48d3d1a-915e-11e6-323a-000c2992f5d9}"
 ▼ 2: object
     date: 1478626172
     agentGuid: "{68125cd6-a5d8-11e6-348e-000c29663178}"
```

Each entry in the array is an object containing details about a system that has
referenced the file. The following information is included in each entry:

* GUID of the system that referenced the file
* Time the system first referenced the file

### Details

The flow exercises the nodes below.

#### Specify file hashes

This is an `inject` input node which starts the flow. This node
injects a new message with a `payload` property which specifies the hashes of
the file to use for the lookup.

#### Set hash request parameters

This is a `change` node which copies the value from the `payload` message
property to the `hashes` property. The `Get first references from TIE` node uses
the `hashes` property when constructing the parameters for the TIE first
references request. 

#### Get first references from TIE

This is a `tie get file first references` node. This node connects to the DXL
fabric and sends a DXL `Request` message to the TIE service to lookup
first references information.

The request message includes the `hashes` properties set by the
`Set hash request parameters` node.

The `Return` property is set to "a parsed JSON object" to indicate that the
payload for the response should be added to the output message as a JavaScript
object decoded from JSON.

#### Output first references

This is a `debug` output node. This node outputs the `payload` set on
the message by the `Get first references from TIE` node. The output should
include information for the systems that have referenced the file.

name: Supply the file hashes in the 'Specify file hashes' node
